alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Dinwiddie; James City; Prince George; Surry; Sussex; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 8:34PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN CHARLES CITY...PRINCE GEORGE...WEST CENTRAL YORK...NORTHEASTERN SUSSEX...EAST CENTRAL DINWIDDIE...SOUTHERN JAMES CITY...AND SURRY COUNTIES...THE CITY OF HOPEWELL...THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF PETERSBURG AND THE CITY OF WILLIAMSBURG THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 833 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Claremont to near Disputanta. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Hopewell, Williamsburg, Charles City, Waverly, Wakefield, Claremont, Surry, Queens Lake, Disputanta, Fort Gregg-Adams, College Of William And Mary, Prince George, Dendron, Busch Gardens, Rustic, Burrowsville, Garysville, Carver Gardens, and Elberon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Dinwiddie; James City; Prince George; Surry; Sussex; York
